alert.note: Alert for Harris (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 6:29AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Harris County through 700 AM EDT... At 629 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over River View, or near Valley, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Mountain Hill, Whitesville-Pine Lake and Lake Harding. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
